description.narrative: The World Bank is funding health programs which use performance based financing in three health regions in CAR. Health facilities receive quarterly contracts and are paid for pre-agreed results once these have been verified. In the CAR, the crisis has resulted in the collapse of the banking system in certain areas and in other places, the presence of armed groups makes moving money problematic.
The immediate target group is formed by the 206 health providers in the WB PASS projects in health regions 2, 3 and 6 and by the regulatory authorities, the Equipe Cadre de District. 100,000 people

The project will fund the handling of cash and the payment of subsidies to health providers in the three health regions (2,3 and 6) in which, under projects funded by the World Bank, Cordaid is already fulfilling the functions of contracting health providers and verifying the results agreed. The objective is to provide payment to the health facilities and save time and money which they would lose if they had to send someone to the capital Bangui to collect cash there. Since roads are extremely poor and o road blocks by armed militia, the project will also improve safety for health staff.
